body.paragraph: A comparison operator (>=) that returns true if the item on the left of the operator is greater than or equal to the item to the right of the operator. Returns false otherwise.

body.example:
a = 2
b = 3
 c = 2
 if b >= a:
	print("b is greater than a")

if c >= a:
	print("c is equal to a")

body.paragraph: Most often used to compare two values and subsequently execute or not execute a block of code based on the value of the comparison.

body.example:
a = 1
b = 5
while b >= a:
	a += 1
print(a)
print(a)
